title: Becoming Native to This Place
description: In six compelling essays, Wes Jackson lays the foundation for a new farming economy grounded in natureâ€™s principles. Exploding the tenets of industrial agriculture, Jackson, a respected advocate for sustainable practices and the founder of The Land Institute, seeks to integrate food production with nature in a way that sustains both.Foreword / Richard C. Edwards --1. The problem --2. Visions and assumptions --3. Science and nature --4. Nature as measure --5. Becoming native to our places --6. Developing the courage of our convictions
author: Wes Jackson
